modules.description: This module implements partitioned block device access with operations to connect, read, write, and create subpartitions. It works with block devices and Cstruct buffers, handling errors like out-of-bounds access and I/O failures. Use cases include managing disk partitions and layered storage abstractions.

This module implements partitioned block device access, providing operations to connect to block devices, read from and write to specific partitions, and create subpartitions dynamically. It works directly with block device interfaces and Cstruct buffers, ensuring proper bounds checking and error handling for I/O operations. Use cases include disk partition management, virtual disk layering, and implementing storage abstractions in unikernels.

This module implements block device access with partitioning support based on the Master Boot Record (MBR). It provides operations to connect to a block device, read from and write to specific sectors, retrieve device information, and disconnect cleanly. The module works with `Cstruct.t` buffers for data transfer, `int64` for sector addressing, and `Mbr.Partition.t` to represent partition metadata. It is used to access and manipulate disk partitions directly, such as reading partition tables, performing I/O on specific partitions, or managing storage devices with MBR-based layouts.

This module enables direct access to block devices with MBR-based partitioning by providing functions to connect, read from, and write to specific sectors, along with retrieving device metadata. It operates on `Cstruct.t` buffers for data transfer, uses `int64` for sector addresses, and handles partition metadata via `Mbr.Partition.t`. It is suitable for tasks like inspecting or modifying disk partitions, performing low-level I/O on MBR-partitioned storage, or implementing custom disk management tools.
